nodes.text: Nozho was a city-state on the planet Bith, homeworld of the sentient Bith species. Around three centuries before the Galactic Civil War, Nozho entered into a civil war with the city-state of Weogar. The conflict was short-lived, as both sides launched biological, chemical and mutagenic weapons against the other. These weapons shattered Bith's ecosystem and ultimately killed the majority of the world's population. This led to the world being quarantined and a dramatic shift in Bith culture.

Nozho was first mentioned in the new Star Wars canon in Fully Operational, a 2018 roleplaying supplement produced by Fantasy Flight Games for the Star Wars: Age of Rebellion system. The city originated in the Star Wars Legends continuity, where it was first mentioned in the 1989 roleplaying supplement Galaxy Guide 4: Alien Races, which was written by Troy Denning for West End Games' Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game.
